document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Mathematics

B9CC3510402D4BBF98020FFDF3DD6327.description: communicate statistical results in oral and written formats using appropriate statistical and nontechnical language.

E642B2123EB2448B8CE3639EB4A4A0E6.description: justify the design and the conclusion(s) of statistical studies, including the methods used; and

D5B53E2068CE4DEEBD1604B8D4009FF6.description: report results of statistical studies to a particular audience, including selecting an appropriate presentation format, creating graphical data displays, and interpreting results in terms of the question studied;

DCB220E352C74C34B99AED847EDDF88C.description: analyze possible sources of data variability, including those that can be controlled and those that cannot be controlled;

F5C6F64655764BBFBE39A25E3C850BB3.description: create data displays for given data sets to investigate, compare, and estimate center, shape, spread, and unusual features of the data;

7FD83A690C2B4931B5381CE8D746D275.description: determine possible sources of statistical bias in a study and how bias may affect the validity of the results;

1560200EC5FA4C178DB321F13E757795.description: identify the variables to be used in a study;

CF0CEAC2D7C2499085BD850A284BD3B9.description: identify the population of interest for a statistical investigation, select an appropriate sampling technique, and collect data;

4ABA5497E5084FC0967FF102F7F0F7C0.description: determine the need for and purpose of a statistical investigation and what type of statistical analysis can be used to answer a specific question or set of questions;

F7EB92E24DEE4085A90687084D7270AE.description: describe strengths and weaknesses of sampling techniques, data and graphical displays, and interpretations of summary statistics and other results appearing in a study, including reports published in the media;

B1BF4AFE5FE64DD1AB352E829AB3D861.description: identify potential misuses of statistics to justify particular conclusions, including assertions of a cause-and-effect relationship rather than an association, and missteps or fallacies in logical reasoning;

136BA6C79F2E49B1A0347BAA04E11628.description: interpret and compare statistical results using appropriate technology given a margin of error;

2173D391967240AB9A159EA0DD295F83.description: identify limitations and lack of relevant information in studies reporting statistical information, especially when studies are reported in condensed form;

BE6EDFFA3461454DB9825C19D39B1528.description: determine the validity of logical arguments that include compound conditional statements by constructing truth tables;

14C5EE1E830B469BBB8E3777E37A4A58.description: calculate expected value to analyze mathematical fairness, payoff, and risk;

8F0B2198F0B442068607206F6EE79554.description: use probabilities to make and justify decisions about risks in everyday life;

CD7CFB3307BF47F4830413230A18AE5D.description: interpret conditional probabilities and probabilities of compound events by analyzing representations to make decisions in problem situations;

628AC10ED9194D92A800B6E6CE2E899E.description: calculate conditional probabilities and probabilities of compound events using tree diagrams, Venn diagrams, area models, and formulas;

F72314E2FCFD4C14AE0B4EBF6120D8EF.description: use the Addition Rule, P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A and B), in mathematical and real-world problems;

422ED4D46C974F2DABEA1129C66406D7.description: use a two-way frequency table as a sample space to identify whether two events are independent and to interpret the results;

FAE7CA2DD5CC48BC8E8ABEB70FD7DE3A.description: Probabilistic and statistical reasoning. The student uses the process standards in mathematics to generate new understandings of probability and statistics. The student analyzes statistical information and evaluates risk and return to connect mathematical ideas and make informed decisions. The student applies a problem-solving model and statistical methods to design and conduct a study that addresses one or more particular question(s). The student uses multiple representations to communicate effectively the results of student-generated statistical studies and the critical analysis of published statistical studies. The student is expected to:

1EC95AA039C54F48A34997374074A684.description: create, represent, and analyze mathematical models and appropriate representations, including formulas and amortization tables, for various types of loans and investments to determine the best option for a given situation.

CFD147D646584A8496680A1918522F8C.description: create, represent, and analyze mathematical models for expenditures, including those involving credit, to determine the best option for a given situation; and

DA6762E4E1CC4A8E81E5BCA8FB788258.description: create, represent, and analyze mathematical models for various types of income calculations to determine the best option for a given situation;

535629999F054B01A3D1701A6FF21741.description: determine or analyze an appropriate piecewise model for problem situations;

A4BBF0259C6F40CF8C2BFD3087E6F397.description: determine or analyze an appropriate cyclical model for problem situations that can be modeled with periodic functions;

51FA84EE6347432C8D835915505397B8.description: determine or analyze an appropriate growth or decay model for problem situations, including linear, exponential, and logistic functions;

215B0C3B7A204975BAD8401FB9585D00.description: describe the degree to which uncorrelated variables may or may not be related and analyze situations where correlated variables do or do not indicate a cause-and-effect relationship;

C556539239C1416F93F222FCA113227A.description: collect numerical bivariate data to create a scatterplot, select a function to model the data, justify the model selection, and use the model to interpret results and make predictions;

660D13294B234F4A9F6D8AF9F621F1EA.description: Algebraic reasoning (expressions, equations, and generalized relationships). The student applies the process standards in mathematics to create and analyze mathematical models of everyday situations to make informed decisions related to earning, investing, spending, and borrowing money by appropriate, proficient, and efficient use of tools, including technology. The student uses mathematical relationships to make connections and predictions. The student judges the validity of a prediction and uses mathematical models to represent, analyze, and solve dynamic real-world problems. The student is expected to:

2825778C7A15450FBB68F17C8F73BA9B.description: select and apply an algorithm of interest to solve real-life problems such as problems using recursion or iteration involving population growth or decline, fractals, and compound interest; the validity in recorded and transmitted data using checksums and hashing; sports rankings, weighted class rankings, and search engine rankings; and problems involving scheduling or routing situations using vertex-edge graphs, critical paths, Euler paths, and minimal spanning trees and communicate to peers the application of the algorithm in precise mathematical and nontechnical language.

60C38451666742919FCC6644AD7AAF64.description: analyze various voting and selection processes to compare results in given situations; and

8028D2A9D6F24C8482C860F5AFE99689.description: use arrays to efficiently manage large collections of data and add, subtract, and multiply matrices to solve applied problems, including geometric transformations;

B940C968516940CCBBBC4D32975B797E.description: solve problems involving large quantities using combinatorics;

3A65AAF398174CBF8F1F5141DE5EF1D9.description: solve geometric problems involving indirect measurement, including similar triangles, the Pythagorean Theorem, Law of Sines, Law of Cosines, and the use of dynamic geometry software;

0F516B6DFEE1466DB943DAA6BE9F53B5.description: solve problems involving quantities that are not easily measured using proportionality;

2156EB6D4EC2497ABFF3CF8B5F178290.description: apply and analyze published ratings, weighted averages, and indices to make informed decisions;

2E444E519A674106AF3F92958249FBB8.description: use precision and accuracy in real-life situations related to measurement and significant figures;

24650765A2824D7D96C7EF5A1E571227.description: Numeric reasoning. The student applies the process standards in mathematics to generate new understandings by extending existing knowledge. The student generates new mathematical understandings through problems involving numerical data that arise in everyday life, society, and the workplace. The student extends existing knowledge and skills to analyze real-world situations. The student is expected to:

5553020B9725480498F29FA248FF7234.description: display, explain, and justify mathematical ideas and arguments using precise mathematical language in written or oral communication.

766CB4F823F94628B880B7268387FB63.description: analyze mathematical relationships to connect and communicate mathematical ideas; and

D003BA0C03394B18AB13F6EECBA43C56.description: create and use representations to organize, record, and communicate mathematical ideas;

DB9FCDBA676C436FAA9FF3D17983C50E.description: communicate mathematical ideas, reasoning, and their implications using multiple representations, including symbols, diagrams, graphs, and language as appropriate;

FE477E215DD94DE09621285B86255639.description: select tools, including real objects, manipulatives, paper and pencil, and technology as appropriate, and techniques, including mental math, estimation, and number sense as appropriate, to solve problems;

013F918725094E3197517C73C4AE9F67.description: use a problem-solving model that incorporates analyzing given information, formulating a plan or strategy, determining a solution, justifying the solution, and evaluating the problem-solving process and the reasonableness of the solution;

F3A44183B3044B89A7B3FAC7FEB88DBC.description: apply mathematics to problems arising in everyday life, society, and the workplace;

DAC1D84F2B5349ADBD2C4C84C23073DE.description: Mathematical process standards. The student uses mathematical processes to acquire and demonstrate mathematical understanding. The student is expected to:
